intro: Stylidium applanatum, commonly known as the flat-stemmed stick lily, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Haemodoraceae, which includes plants known for their striking floral displays. It thrives in sandy or gravelly soils and is often found in open habitats such as heathlands and coastal dunes. Stylidium applanatum is a perennial herb that produces seed capsules following flowering, contributing to its reproductive strategy in its native environment.
